text: CLOSE ON...   A BRONZE PLAQUE which reads, "PEARL STREET
ON THE BRIDGE... RAIN POURS DOWN. An SUV steers out of control and CRASHES into a STALLED OUT VEHICLE. It's quiet NOW, EXCEPT FOR THE INCESSANT pounding rain. THE DISTANCE, police lights approach.

THROUGH A TELEVISION CAMERA... The image is GRAINY and FRENETIC. A HEAVY RAIN POURS DOWN on a MELEE OF ACTIVITY. POLICE CARS block either end, their LIGHTS ignite the sky a dizzying RED and BLUE design. The attention centers on. The SUV and the CRASHED VEHICLE lay in the middle of the bridge. A MAN, 30's, madness on his face, his right hand holds a HOSTAGE, a woman, 20's, racked with fear, tight t his body. His left holds a GUN! Two DETECTIVES, slowly approach the Man.   ONLY SEE THE DETECTIVES FROM BEHIND. A News Reporter, KAREN CROSS, 30's, blond with energy to burn, shields herself from the rain, steps in front of th camera...
... Police on scene are approaching the suspect. They're at the center of the Bridge now. The Man waves his gun wildly, screams at the Detectives. Hostage, tears streaming down her face, SCREAMS OUT!
SUDDENLY...   THREE GUN SHOTS, almost simultaneously, RIN
We have shots fired. Shots have been fired... Both the suspect and his hostage are down... Police are moving in... Oh my God.

A loft apartment, scarcely furnished, except for BOOKS, HUNDREDS OF THEM, fill stacks of shelves. Hearing but not watching the television, METICULOUSLY preparing a GIN AND TONIC, is... DETECTIVE QUENTIN CONNERS, a grizzled, intense veteran. H charisma, which he has in spades, gets him into as much trouble as it gets him out of. At present a somber mood. The shadows from the rain stream down Conners's face. IN THE GLASS'S REFLECTION... The TV Report plays. (NOTE: most of, if not all, of the TV report will in reflection.

After a two month investigation, Det. Jason York has been relieved of duty for his role in the Pearl Street Bridge shooting deaths of Lisa ReAnn and John Curtis. Key testimony against York came from Det. Bernard Callo, who was on scene that night. The Seattle Police Department is handing this case over to the King County District Attorney's office. Criminal charges are expected.
The IMAGE cuts to an earlier interview with... CAPTAIN MARTIN JENKINS, 50's, chronically tired and unsympathetic

In a civilized society, the men and women entrusted with serving and protecting the community are to be held accountable just like everyone else. Simply put... Just because you are a cop, doesn't mean laws don't apply to you. This is no longer the wild, wild west.
KAREN CROSS stands on the steps, a PHOTO of Conners appea
This same review board last week found Quentin Conners, Det. York's partner, "not responsible" for the same shooting. He remains on suspension without pay.
Conners turns off the TV, lays the remote next to a PHOTO Conners and a YOUNG WOMAN (TEDDY) during happy times. He stares at the photo, finishes his drink.

A COOL, CRISP Pacific Northwestern day. MOUNT RAINIER loo in the distance. The SPACE NEEDLE overlooks downtown. Whi the sun shines now, the OVERCAST SKY on the horizon FORESHADOWS AN IMPENDING STORM. In the heart of the city.
An IMPRESSIVE STRUCTURE on a BUSY CITY CORNER. TRAFFIC, street and pedestrian, go about their business. ACROSS THE STREET...   A BLACK TRUCK screeches to a stop.

LORENZ, 40's, sits behind the steering wheel. His EYES co merciless. He's joined by FOUR OTHER MEN, ALL BLACK CLAD HEAVILY ARMED with BODY ARMOR! Lorenz stares out at the bank, a last moment of peace. Simultaneously, ALL FOUR DOORS OPEN and...
Lorenz and the Black Clad exit, quickly cross the street, heading for the bank! Each carries a LARGE BLACK BAG.

PATRONS in line, wait impatiently. A SECURITY GUARD in th corner yawns. TELLERS count out cash, access accounts on COMPUTERS. GRAINY SECURITY CAMERA IMAGES depict an average, business day. THE CALM BEFORE THE STORM.
Lorenz and the Black Clad arrive at the doors.     They R THEIR MASKS and...
Off the CROOKED EYEBROW of a BANK TELLER...
The BLACK CLAD STORM THE BANK! Four of the Black Clad mov into position. Lorenz stands center stage. Gun in hand, h aims at the ceiling, PULLS the trigger... BAM! A GUNSHOT
Drop to the floor! Slowly! No sudden moves! (to the Tellers)

You! Hands on heads, drop to your knees. Now! Do it! PATRONS and TELLERS HIT THE GROUND, TERRIFIED!     Lorenz COMPLETE and UTTER CONTROL. BLACK CLAD #4 and #3 keep watch on the tellers behind the counters! One on one side, one on the other. BLACK CLAD #2 ushers people out of side offices, gun-poin them into the lobby! BLACK CLAD #1 races upstairs, gathers people from the 2nd level, forces them downstairs. From the corner of Lorenz's eye...      The SECURITY GUAR creeps toward his gun.

That... you don't want to do. The Security Guard reluctantly obeys. BLACK CLAD #1 DISAR the Guard, then GUN BUTTS HIM over the head! The Guard drops, unconscious! CUSTOMERS, EMPLOYEES scream out. Black Clad #1 rips keys from the Guard's belt, tosses the Black Clad #2!
Y'all picked the wrong day not to use the ATM. (Beat)
You will not be harmed if you do exactly what I say, when I say it. You
LORENZ (cont'd)
take your chances if you choose not to listen. BLACK CLAD #2, keys in hand, flies across the counter, carrying a large duffel bag... Heading to the vaults!
No one will say I didn't give you a choice.
Black Clad #2 arrives, drops his bag, unzipping...
(into his headset)
I'm in.
Lorenz gets the message, finds THE BANK MANAGER cowering behind his desk.
You, up. (the Bank Manager obeys)
You understood what I just said?
Yes.
Your security system, you can electronically lock all entrances...
Yes.   Right-right away.

With that attitude, you and I are going to get along famously. Now go. The Bank Manager nods nervously. BLACK CLAD #4 holds open his bag. He strides by the CUSTOMERS who deposit CELLPHONES, PAGERS, inside.
The Bank Manager taps on his computer keyboard.
It's done.     We're locked down.
Lorenz nods.
BLACK CLAD #1 flips the "BANK CLOSED" sign around.
Jenkins fastens his cufflinks.   In the bed behind him... HEATHER "TEDDY" GALLOWAY, 30's, normally a force to recko with, appears vulnerable with only a sheet wrapped around her.

Have you seen my watch? Teddy gestures to the night stand. Jenkins retrieves the watch. He also slides his WEDDING RING back on. This ain' love, this is a relationship of convenience. Jenkins slips on his jacket, secures his tie and, after o last check in the mirror...
This was fun. You should get out of bed. You'll be late for work. And with that, Jenkins exits. Teddy waits for the door to close, then collapses back onto the bed.
PLASTIC EXPLOSIVES line the walls, connect all the safety deposit boxes together! BLACK CLAD #2, takes cover, readi the detonation device and...
(into his headset)
Fire in the hole. He FLIPS A SWITCH and... KA-BOOM!    AN EXPLOSION RIPS TH
A PILLOW OF SMOKE BLOWS into the lobby! Lorenz stands UNFLINCHING. The explosion was expected.
An EAGER TELLER, 30's, seizes the moment.    He reaches u
BLACK CLAD #4 turns just in time to see it, quickly FIRES weapon! The Eager Teller slumps against the wall, BLEEDS profusely from his neck, not dead yet. Lorenz hustles over to Black Clad #4.
What do you think you're doing?
Fucker pushed the alarm. Lorenz GLARES DISGUSTEDLY at his accomplice.
It would've made more sense to shoot him before he pushes the fucking alarm. Not after. (looks at the Eager Teller)
Jesus. Lorenz levels, very calmly, his weapon at the Eager Telle head and...
And... If you're going to do something. (FIRES his weapon!)
Do it right. The Eager's Teller's body keels over, dead.    Lorenz che his watch... 9:26 a.m.
(into microphone)
Alarm's tripped. We're on a clock. (to Black Clad #4)
Get these people out of the way.
The Four Seasons it ain't.
There's not enough soap on the planet for Teddy to feel clean. Doubt and fear present on her face. She turns off the water, and steps out... when she does HER PAGER, off screen, chimes!
Teddy, a towel wrapped around her, picks up the pager. number: 911. She picks up the TELEPHONE, dials.
(beat, then)
This is Detective Galloway.

SIRENS BLARE... POLICE CARS brake hard, blocking traffic. OFFICERS fly out, shotguns out! HELICOPTERS circle. NEWS VANS speed onto the scene as the CROWDS builds. Standing in the center of things... DETECTIVE BERNIE CALLO, 40's, a stern, by-the-book cop. N a popular member of the force. TWO OFFICERS, 30's, follow him.
(into his radio)
I want all points of entry identified and covered. We need SWAT here now. Have emergency crews standing by!
(re: the Media)
Didn't take them long.
Set a perimeter.    Move'em back.
How far?
Portland.
A phone cord is YANKED from the wall! Black Clad #1 and #4 push Customers and Employees inside! They door SLAMS SHUT.

POV OF LORENZ - Callo approaches the Tech Van. Lorenz peeks through the curtains.       A phone pressed his shoulder and ear. He places a VOICE MODULATOR over the phone's mouthpiece ( will leave his voice sounding LIFELESS and DISTORTED to t on the receiving end).
Callo arrives at the POLICE TECH VAN.    So state-of-the- NASA is green with envy. BRENDAN DAX, 30's, the techno-wizard, with headphones on, hands Callo a phone. Several other OFFICERS listen in.
We have them on the line. Dax presses a series of buttons.
We're hot.
(into phone)
This is Detective Callo, Seattle P.D. Who am I speaking with?

No questions. It's time to set the rules. I am in complete control of this facility. No one gets in or out without my say and I will execute every last man, woman and child in here if my needs are not met. Do not test me. Today, I am a man of zero patience.
I'm listening.
See if you can't screw this up, Detective... I have but one demand. One and only demand.

Conners wears a T-shirt and some sweats, opens his refrigerator, grabs a bottle of water. When he closes the door... He notices Jenkins and a YOUNG DETECTIVE on his deck. Conners crosses, opens the door for Jenkins and DETECTIVE SHANE DEKKER, late-20s. Dekker's all business when it com to being a cop. Green, but eager to prove himself. After long beat...
Do you have a warrant?
JENKINS
I need to speak to you, Quentin. CONNERS
There's where your shit out of luck because I don't need to speak to you. JENKINS
It's important. Conners and Jenkins trade serious stares. Conners finally relents. Jenkins and Dekker enter. Dekker notices - THE STACKS AND STACKS OF BOOKS. JENKINS
Quentin, this is Detective Shane Dekker. CONNERS
Huh? You don't look like much of a Detective. DEKKER
Funny. I was going to say the same about you. CONNERS
Charming. JENKINS
Shane just transferred in from Tacoma.      His father... CONNERS

Save your breath. I really don't care. Before Jenkins can respond, from the bedroom, a TALL, BLO WOMAN, 20s, emerges, COMPLETELY NUDE. The men WATCH as the Woman, PAYING THEM NO ATTENTION, retrieves a bottle of water from the fridge, then returns the bedroom. No words spoken at all. After the moment has passed... CONNERS
Why don't we can the chit-chat.    Get to what's on your mind. JENKINS
We've got a hostage situation, American National Bank. The sonsabitches said they wouldn't talk to anyone but you. CONNERS
No shit?
JENKINS
No shit.   I need you to do this. CONNERS
Why should I? DEKKER
Because people's lives are at stake. That takes priority over your ego. CONNERS
(to Jenkins; re: Dekker) You may want to put a leash on him. (beat; thinks) Saying I did want to help... I'm still suspended or did that slip your mind? JENKINS
The commissioner's office has ordered me to reinstate you. As of now, you're back on the force. CONNERS
Just like that? JENKINS
Just like that. (beat) I won't, however, unleash you alone. CONNERS
Always a catch. JENKINS
Shane, here, is your new partner. Consider him a younger version of me, looking over your shoulder, watching every move you make. The idea of a new partner doesn't sit well with Conners. JENKINS
Don't think I endorse this. If it were my call, you'd be with your partner... CONNERS
You mean ex-partner. JENKINS
... On the unemployment line with him. CONNERS
For a moment there, I thought you cared.
I care about those innocent people down there. I hope to God someone hasn't made a monumental mistake letting you back in.
I appreciate the words of encouragement and the confidence you have in me. I look forward to the continuing, positive relationship we've shared in the past.

POLICE CORRAL the ever-growing group of SPECTATORS. A SWAT TRUCK pulls up, the BACK DOORS FLY OPEN!     SWAT a flurry, race into position. Amidst the commotion... JENKINS' CAR navigates the scene, stops next to... KAREN CROSS immediately recognizes Conne orders her CAMERAMAN to center on him. Conners, Dekker and Jenkins climb out of the car, head towards the crime scene, when...
Detective Conners? Detective, can we have a few words? Conners turns, recognizes Karen.    Relishing the moment.
I'll give you two... (pauses for effect)
Blow me. If you need a follow-up comment let me know? (to Dekker)
Cunt made her career off me.

Conners, Dekker and Jenkins arrive, FIND Teddy, her hair still wet, with her partner, DET. VINCENT DURANO, 40's, a middle of the road, never out on a limb type cop. Callo looks on, the RAGE boiling inside of him. CONNERS
Teddy, Vincent... (completely ignores Callo) ... Nice to see you both. JENKINS
Conners has been reinstated to full active duty. It's his scene. This info comes as a surprise.   Especially to Callo. CALLO
The last hostage situation this guy headed, an innocent civilian died. CONNERS
I was not responsible... CALLO
You never are. That girl would be alive today if it weren't for your cowboy antics. You destroy lives. CONNERS
Fuck you. Look who's talking about destroying lives. JENKINS
Decision's been made, Bernie. CALLO
I was first on scene and I have seniority. (pleads) Don't do this, Martin. JENKINS
We'll talk about it later.   Take a hike. CALLO
(beat) Fine. I'll watch this train wreck from home. Callo exits. CONNERS
(sarcastic) I'm going to miss him.
SWAT, because of the special circumstances will defer to Conners. He's in charge.
First time I've heard SWAT defer to anyone.
(pulls aside Conners)
Second chances don't come around often. Don't blow it. Jenkins skeptically eyes Conners before stepping away. motions for Dekker to walk with him.
Anything questionable happens today, you let me know.
Yes, Captain. Out of earshot, Conners watches Dekker and Jenkins.
Looks like you got yourself a baby- sitter. Conners glares at Teddy out the corner of his eye, then dismisses the comment.
More SPECTATORS, more MEDIA. Conners, Dekker, Teddy and Vincent hover behind the first barricade. Conners unwraps gum, sticks it in his mouth.
We have approximately four to seven, heavily armed men holding an unspecified number of customers and employees hostage.
You're just a wealth of knowledge, aren't you?
Witnesses heard shots fired and some kind of explosion. And their only demand has been to speak with you.
I'm sure it won't be the last. Get me a line into the bank. Let's see what they really want.
Lorenz enters, shuts the door and REMOVES HIS MASK.    He a few rings pass, before ANSWERING.
(into voice modulator)
Detective Conners?
Conners and company gather outside of the Police Tech Van Dekker pulls a pad and a pen, prepares to take notes. Dax sits, headphones donned, records the entire conversat
Who am I speaking with?
For now...     You can call me Lorenz. Dekker writes, "Lorenz."
Okay, Lorenz, how are we doing in there? Can we get you anything? Food, medical supplies. We heard an explosion.

Everyone who matters is fine. Of course, I would've preferred not having the authorities involved at all. We weren't planning to be here this long. But, since Seattle's finest needs a presence on the scene, I'm glad it's you.
CONNERS
My fame proceeds me. LORENZ

Don't be flattered. I needed someone who's been through the experience before. Hopefully this time it will go better for all involved. I plan on living a full, long and rich life. I didn't, however, expect them to find you so quickly. I thought you were suspended. Dekker writes, "In The Know," on his pad. CONNERS
I was, but I'm back.   You're information's old. LORENZ
You never get what you pay for. (back to business) You want to know about the hostages? How many and are they okay? Dekker scribbles, "Pro". CONNERS
Yes. LORENZ
Approximately forty, they're fine, considering. All except one. We had a situation. CONNERS
Someone's dead? LORENZ

Theory... put to practice isn't always perfect. Can't expect to keep the hostages in check if a bad deed goes unpunished or they may... randomly decide to revolt. Chaos... has some order to it. (Conners drifts in thought) Detective? Are you still with me? Teddy SNAPS her fingers. That gets Conners attention. There's a new intensity to his demeanor. CONNERS
What else will I be looking for?
Demands... Probably too much to ask for you and your colleagues to pack up and go home?
Safe to say.
Stay by the phone.    I'll contact you shortly.
Lorenz...
Don't worry, I have no plans until sunrise tomorrow, so hunker down. It's going to be a long one.
Wait, we're talking here...
Patience, Detective. We don't want another Pearl Street Bridge, do we? Conners's thrown by the mention of Pearl Street Bridge. Lorenz abruptly HANGS UP.
He's off.
THE CROWDS GROW. The MEDIA BUILD UP INTENSIFIES.    THROU TELEVISION CAMERA... Karen Cross reports:

This standoff is approaching two hours now. We've been told Detectives have made contact with the perpetrators inside the bank. Whether any specific demands have been made, we cannot confirm. As soon as we know something, we'll pass it on to you. Reporting live, Karen Cross, channel two news.
We're clear.
Who the hell writes this shit?

Black Clad #1 and #4 remove from their bag - ropes, pulle an iron spike and hammer. #1 also removes... a spear-gun. #1 connects the rope to a spear. FIRES the spear into the wall above the bank's front windows! He snags a 2nd spear repeats.
The Detectives huddle.   Impatience level high.
(to Dax)
Try again.
He's not picking up.
(stern)
Try again. Dax, humbled, does as ordered.
(glances about)
Where's our fearless Captain?
Went uptown to brief the Commissioner.
So you're here in his place. Conners fumbles with the wrapper, but eventually sticks another piece of gum in his mouth. Teddy notices.
Nicotine gum.
(shock)
You quit smoking?
Caffeine, too, if you must know. (Another shock)
What? A man's capable of change.
A man, yes. You...     I'm not so sure.
CONNERS
Don't worry, I still have a vice or two. DAX
Fifteen rings.    No answer. CONNERS
Try again in five. TEDDY
What are they doing in there? VINCENT
Wasting our time. Time. The word rings in Conners's head.     He starts to together. CONNERS

Precisely. He knows police protocol, not to mention the shit in our own precinct. He's disguising his voice, means he's got a record and has done this before. He's heavily armed and well-connected. He knows he's surrounded. He hasn't asked for a damned thing. He drops that hint about sunrise, prepping us for a long wait. He's buying time. Why? VINCENT
(brainstorming) To figure out his next move.    He wasn't expecting us. DEKKER
No, he wasn't expecting you. He said, he thought you were still suspended. CONNERS
Probably thought it would take the whole day for you to find me. Giving him the time he needs. TEDDY
He's stalling. DEKKER
He almost has what he came for. Conners nods, eyes Dekker as if for the first time. SHOOTING SCRIPT                MARCH 15, 2004       20. CONNERS
Or... he's got what he came for and he's waiting for his ticket out of here. (the decision) We're going in. TEDDY
What? CONNERS

The bank has three points of entry. Teddy and Vincent, take a SWAT Team, head to the West side. We'll have the SWAT Commander take the East. Dekker, you're with me. Where is the SWAT Commander? VINCENT
I'll find him. Vincent leaves Conners with Dekker and Teddy. TEDDY
(to Conners; concern) That's a big call, Quentin.   Thought about what you're doing? CONNERS
You questioning me, Teddy? TEDDY
Unfortunately... yeah. CONNERS
I question how you can fuck that asshole and still manage to look in the mirror. TEDDY
I'm not going to get into this now. And you're one to talk. I hear... CONNERS

(interrupting) The hostages are in imminent danger. They've confessed to killing someone, an automatic murder one charge - that's a life sentence, maybe a needle for all of them. So why keep witnesses around to testify? Longer we wait, the greater the risk. We need to go in. Now.
(beat; then relents)
Okay. Even Dekker seems to agree with that theory. Vincent arri with the SWAT COMMANDER, 40's, a former Navy SEAL with a "Don't FUCK with me" attitude.
I got snipers up top and ten soldiers on the ground.
What's the best way in?
Tear gas, blow the doors...
Hold on. No explosives. I got forty civilians in there, too great a chance.    Any other way?
There's no pussy way in. The doors are locked electronically from the inside. We ain't getting in without force.
(beat; thinks)
What if we cut the power? That will disable the system and we can open the locks manually, come in that way?
(thinks; concedes)
That'll work.
So we'll take the pussy way, Commander. We cut the power and go in at 11:15 sharp!
SNIPERS ON ROOFTOPS ready their weapons.    SWAT TEAM mov into position, cover all bank entrances.
Conners and Dekker slip into bulletproof vests.     Teddy Vincent and the SWAT Commander arrive.
The bank's equipped with emergency generators, which once the power's down, will kick back on in approximately 3-6 minutes.
It will be over before that. Commander, your men in position?
Standing by.
I will call for the power to be cut. Once down, wait for my signal and enter. No one moves until I give the "go", understood?
They all nod.    They're ready.
You have done this before, right? Wait... I don't want to know.

VARIOUS SHOTS of HOSTAGES. It's quiet, until... Black Cla #1 and #4 burst, grab TWO RANDOM HOSTAGES, drag them out! They put up some fight, but quickly concede. The hostages sit shaking, crying...    Scared beyond beli
Lorenz watches out the window... POV OF LORENZ - SWAT, POLICE getting into position. Lorenz turns from the window.
They're comin'.
Black Clad #1 and #4 drag the TWO RANDOM HOSTAGES, KICKIN AND SCREAMING, towards the anchor/pulley!
What are you doing?! Let me go!
#1 & #4 fasten the Hostages to ropes connected to the pulleys!
Behind a barricade, Conners crouches down beside Dekker a his SWAT Team.
(into radio)
Let's go around the horn.
Teddy, Vincent and a SWAT Team...
One, check.
The SWAT Commander and his team...
Two, check.
A SNIPER holds his eye to the scope.
Three, check.
Four, check.
Conners glances at his watch...
Here we go... Cut the power.
Instantly...   EVERYTHING BLACKS OUT!   LIGHTS, COMPUTERS THE HOSTAGES grab each other TIGHTLY.   PANIC evident. and the Black Clad calmly react.
Conners makes the call...
Doors! Each Team makes their move, when...
(into his headset)
Now!
Black Clad #1 PULLS A CORD, instantly...     ALL THE CURT
Conners freezes...
(into radio)
Hold it. What just happened?

Black Clad #3 FLIPS A SWITCH. Suddenly, a canister attach to the pulleys race up the ropes! The HOSTAGES have their feet yanked out from under them, then shoot INTO THE AIR! They SMASH THROUGH A GLASS HANDRAIL ON THE SECOND FLOOR, then...
SHOOT to the TOP OF THE WALL-LENGTH WINDOWS! They hang, dangle helplessly! On FULL DISPLAY for the outside to see
(looking up at the windows)
Holy shit...?! DEKKER. CONNERS. SWAT. ONLOOKERS.       Everyone in the vicinity react in HORROR! THE NEWS CREWS, led by Karen Cross, race to grab the stor
The SWAT Commander:
We're going in!
Officers try to control the situation, but can't. Pedestrians racing around. Conners, in the middle of the anarchy...
No.    Do not go in.   It's a trap!
Stand down, Detective. This is my show now.
(flustered)
The SWAT Commander makes his own call...
On my count... One... two... three... The SWAT TEAM bum rushes the bank, just as... KABOOM!   A FIREBALL BLASTS through the door, BLOWS off i hinges!   The SWAT guys are blown off their feet! Then...
Everyone outside is BLOWN OFF THEIR FEET! Conners, Dekker
Simultaneously, An EXPLOSIONS BLASTS OUT THE WEST SIDE DO

head_text.subj: THE DETECTIVES AND SWAT TEAM DUCK FROM THE BLAST
THE BLACK CLAD'S TRUCK EXPLODES, FLIPS IN THE AIR

text: It's a genuine WAR ZONE!    SMOKE, FIRE AND DEBRIS LITTER
Conners peers up as...    The HOSTAGES RUN OUT, SCREAM IN
Conners and Dekker head for the bank, pass two groups of UNIFORMED OFFICERS...
(to the first group)
Round up all the hostages, anyone that comes out, grab'em! Conners glares at Dekker.
(to the second)

The rest of you, come with us. The OFFICERS rush to protect the HOSTAGES, pull them to safety. CAMERA CREWS and REPORTERS pounce on the opportunity. Conners and Dekker lead the charge inside, guns drawn.
EMERGENCY LIGHTS BURN! GLASS CRACKLES UNDER FOOT as Conne Dekker and the Officers move through. Caution with each step. The lobby's clear.   Conners pulls the Officers close.
(whispers; to Dekker)
We split up. (whispers; to the officers)
You two with him. You two with me. (to Dekker)
Check the back. Dekker nods, leads his group away.      Conner proceeds..
Nothing. Conners spots a DOOR in the back marked, "Bank Employees Only."
Dekker checks it out, but it's empty. The remnants of the explosion remain. Suddenly... THE GENERATORS ROAR TO LIFE
Dekker jumps, startled by the sudden blast of lights.
ALL THE LIGHTS COME UP, as...   Conners KICKS IN THE DOOR but... It's empty.

Dekker leads his group. His heart POUNDING THROUGH HIS CHEST. His Gun up and ready. Suddenly... A NOISE up ahead... He bares down, takes a DEEP BREATH, carefully proceeds until... Teddy and Vincent emerge. Ted EXHALES, lowers her weapon. So does Dekker.
Conners strides out from behind the counters...
(to Vincent)
See anyone come your way?
No.   No one went by me. The SWAT COMMANDER approaches holding a couple of the BLA MASKS, some BLACK BODY ARMOR.
Detectives... We found these. Conners takes one of the masks in his hands.
We let them walk right past us. Dekker, Teddy, the SWAT Commander, Officers, Vincent and SWAT Team stand in the middle of the lobby, STUNNED. Conners, his anger SIMMERS TO A BOIL, until finally...

An OFFICER unfurls a FRESH ROLL of "POLICE: CAUTION" TAPE around the scene. Still mayhem, but gradually coming unde control. Police interview HOSTAGES, so do REPORTERS. PARAMEDICS administer oxygen. Two CORONERS load the EAGER TELLER's b into their truck.
Vincent, covered in debris, confers with Conners.

We got the one Teller dead, the two that were strung up are alive, but in critical condition. A few SWAT incurred 2nd degree burns, but that's the worst of it. Now, depending on who you talk to... there was anywhere from five to nine perps. And nobody got a good look at any of'em, wore their masks the whole time. Dax is rounding up the security tapes now. That should give us a firm number.
I want background checks on every hostage. They're all suspects until they're not.
You don't think one of them's still here?
After this, nothing would surprise me.
Dax pulls cables, power cords, etc., getting set to go in with them. Dekker approaches.
Excuse me... I need to listen to the conversation between Lorenz and Conners again?
It'll have to wait.
How long?
Hour.   Maybe more.
(too long)
Show me how to play it myself? SHOOTING SCRIPT                 MARCH 15, 2004        29.

Jenkins.

Me? Both can't help but smile.      Jenkins walks up.

"Return to the earth now if your mind is troubled and your heart is uncertain. For it is by returning to the beginning that we can clearly see the path."

(to Jenkins) Don't look at me, he's your find.

ON A COMPUTER MONITOR - The EIGHT SECURITY CAMERA ANGLES appear. ON THE MULTIPLE SCREENS... Just as in the opening, Lorenz leads this crew through the bank. Immediately the group splits up. IN THE VAULT... One of the Black Clads arrives and radios in. DAX
I've been through these tapes twenty times already and nothing... CONNERS

See what? DEKKER
Go back a little. CONNERS
What? DEKKER
Notice the camera angles, they're all fixed. They don't rotate or pan. Dax rewinds, to before the explosion... DEKKER

There. Stop. Play it. Look closely, camera five, the vault cam, dominates our attention because of the explosion. But while that's happening, check out Camera two, customer service. ON SCREEN... Several BANK EMPLOYEES cower to the Black Cl Suddenly, another Black Clad DISAPPEARS UNDERNEATH THE SECURITY CAMERA. DAX
Where'd he go? ON SCREEN... As the EXPLOSION GOES OFF, CAMERA #2 PANS AW FROM THE CUSTOMER SERVICE SECTION, TOWARDS THE LOBBY.
He moved it. Changed the angle.    He didn't want us to see something.
What's in that corner they didn't want us to see? Dax rewinds the tapes again, before the camera was moved FREEZES FRAME ON: a lone COMPUTER TERMINAL in the corner.
AT THE COMPUTER TERMINAL... A FORENSICS TECHNICIAN, 30's, carefully dusts the computer keyboard for fingerprints. Dekker and Conners look on.
Are you at all concerned that there's some whacko out there looking to get you?
If I worried about every threat made against me, I'd never leave the house. The Technician turns on a BLACK LIGHT and... FINGERPRINTS
Conners looks to Dekker, impressed.
(to the technician)
Those are priority one. If he's got a record, I want an I.D. yesterday.
I'm on my way.
Dax, can you hack in there and find out what they were doing on this machine?
Hack into a nationwide bank's central computer system? Love to.
What do we do in the meantime?
You like Italian?
The ITALIAN RESTAURANT HOST, 50's, jolly with a thick acc greets Conners and Dekker.
Detective, where you been? Much too long. Sit, sit. I give you best table in house. It'll just be the two?
No, four.    More are coming.
Wonderful, wonderful. Who's this young man?
For all intents and purposes... he's Big Brother.
(confused)
He's your brother?
No.
No matter, no matter...     I bring you bottle of house wine!
We're still on duty.     No wine.
(insulted)
No wine?
A little wine.
That's better. They get to the table, Conners looks at it.
Last time I was here, you said that table in the corner was the "best in the house."
It was. Anywhere you sit becomes best table in house. Now relax, I bring you food.
A PIANO PLAYER recreates the sweet sounds of Italy.   PAT sing along. Eating, drinking and being merry.

Vincent and Teddy have joined Conners and Dekker. A MOUNT OF FOOD still remains. A COUPLE BOTTLES OF WINE have been consumed, empty plates and basket rolls spread about. The mood is happy, light. Not thinking about their day. Conners tells an anecdote, something that Teddy and Vince have heard before, but don't care. Dekker watches the Detectives, admires in their closeness.
Shane, what was that thing you said back at the house about "returning to the beginning path" or something?
It's a Buddhist story.
We're all ears.

One day the Buddha found his heart in turmoil. So he retreats to the forest, to the earth, to the base of a great tree and, I'm paraphrasing, but... this elephant comes up and tells Buddha he doesn't like seeing him discouraged.
He can talk to an elephant?
He's the Buddha. He's attained the 6th level of consciousness. He's capable of communicating with plants, trees... even rocks.
Rocks?
You asked.
CONNERS
Continue. DEKKER

The Buddha was troubled so he went back to where he came from, the beginning, to find the path, the answer. So when you hit a dead end, go back to the beginning to find your way. Or something like that. CONNERS
We have a genuine philosopher in our midst. VINCENT
You're a Buddhist? DEKKER
No. Just something I picked up along the way. TEDDY
But you're religious? DEKKER
Not particularly. Conners stares curiously at his new partner.   Then excus himself to go to the men's room. DEKKER
You're all pretty tight. TEDDY
We've been through a lot together. DEKKER
I guess I just thought... I don't know. With all the trouble he's been in lately, coming back from suspension, everyone would treat him differently. VINCENT

You can't believe what you read or see on TV. If anything, our tie to Conners is stronger. He's one of the best. Even when things got pretty wild today and everyone else panicked, he was in control. That doesn't just happen. He's just that good. TEDDY
Excuse me.
Teddy heads for the ladies room.
What was the Buddha looking for?
The divine in himself. Art's confused.    Dekker's cellphone rings.
How long does it usually take to for fingerprints to be ID'd?
Hours, maybe days.    We could be waiting a while.
(answering)
Dekker./ Okay. (Snapping the phone shut...)
They got a match.

LONG CURTAINS divide the rooms. Conners exits the men's room, Teddy appears and before a can be spoken... SHE KISSES HIM HARD, PASSIONATELY ON THE LIPS. Conners gives in for just a moment. He breaks the embrace.
What are you doing?
I realized something today. Being around you, all that's happened...       I can't... I think I made a mistake.
It's too late. You've made your choice. Live with it. This jab hurts Teddy and Conners knows it.     Dekker par curtains...
We got a match. Teddy separates from Conners. SHOOTING SCRIPT                 MARCH 15, 2004        63.
You got a name?
Chris Lei.
(a knowing disgust)
Sonofabitch.
Conners drives, Dekker reads Chris Lei's file. On top of file is a MUGSHOT PHOTO of, "Lei, CHRIS". He's an early-3 Chinese-American with a "weasel factor" off the charts.

Prick used to work for some big-time software company until they caught him dipping into the company's slush fund. They didn't want the publicity so they didn't press charges. Couple years later, he was busted for looting the pension plans of retired cops. For a genius... he's a fucking moron.
This was your case. You and York. You made the bust. Why didn't it stick?

His lawyer put us on trial. Said we were crooked, abusive, that we planted evidence... We were in the midst of the Pearl Street Bridge fallout. Jury bought it. They let him walk and we were the scapegoats.
Was it true?
The guy was guilty. He was scum. That was the truth. (beat)
There's something they don't teach you. The system breaks down. You have to compensate to get results.
That gives you the right to break the rules?
Break, no.     Bend... if it means justice...     Absolutely.
Another thing they don't teach you.
Off the main road, sits a DARK, TWO-STORY HOME on a HILLS

The design is MODERN, FLAWLESS and COLD. Every room is equipped with VIDEO CAMERAS and MONITORS. ON THE MONITOR... The screen is divided into 16 small box showing the actions simultaneously throughout the house. concentration settles on BOX #7...

CHRIS LEI, live and in the flesh, quickly stuffs belongin into a suitcase. He's nervous, tense. From the top drawer of his dresser, he grabs an armful of underwear, socks, d them into the suitcase. What Chris doesn't see...

head_text.subj: IN THE REFLECTION OF THE MIRROR ON THE DRESSER... LOREN

text: Conners pulls the car to the curb.    He and Dekker hop o
From his second floor window, Chris sees Conners and Dekk
Shit. Chris turns, FINDS HIMSELF STARING DOWN A BARREL!
Fare thee well, Chris. Chris swallows, Lorenz pulls the trigger and...
BAM! THE GUNSHOT ECHOES OUTSIDE. Conners and Dekker draw their weapons, quickly descend on the house!

THE FRONT DOOR KICKS IN! Dekker and Conners cautiously enter. They move the way veteran partners would. No indications that these two just met today. The House is almost PITCH BLACK. Conners motions that he's going up, signals for Dekker to take the back of the house.
Dekker proceeds inside.   After a scan, the kitchen's cle
Conners emerges from the stairway.
Dekker steps from the back hallway into the DARKENED livi room. Eyes straight ahead and sharp. What he doesn't see. LORENZ STEPS FROM THE DARKNESS.
Conners moves from the hall, into the bedroom where he finds... Chris's dead Body. He checks for a pulse when he notices... ON THE MONITOR... Conners sees A SHADOWY FIGURE BEHIND Dekker!

Dekker, oblivious to Lorenz's presence, continues on. for the front hallway. Lorenz raises his gun, narrows his sites on Dekker. Simultaneously... CONNERS DIVES, TACKLES DEKKER BEHIND th living room wall -- LORENZ OPENS FIRE, UNLOADS A FULL CLI
Conners and Dekker, behind the wall, regroup. Conners RETALIATES. FIRES FOUR ROUNDS AT LORENZ, but...
Lorenz bursts through the back door, down the stairs!
Conners and Dekker...
You okay?
Yeah.
Dekker and Conners emerge from the house...     LORENZ, o other end of the yard, OPENS FIRE! The Detectives DIVE FOR COVER! Lorenz exits through the fence's door...
... and climbs into a BLACK MERCEDES-BENZ, quickly peels away!
Dekker and Conners bounce up, run out the back fence, but
As they get there... LORENZ'S MERCEDES, turns out of the alley and disappears into the night. Dekker stares out, deflated.
POLICE AND EMERGENCY CREWS surround the house.
An EMERGENCY MEDICAL TECHNICIAN, 30's, attends to Dekker' injured shoulder. Dekker grimaces from the pain. Conners approaches...
First day in the city and you've already been shot.
It just grazed him.
Why don't I "just graze" you with a bullet and see how you feel.
Your Damon Richards is awake.
To establish.
HANDCUFFS lock Richards to his bed. Richards is hooked up an IV and a tube's up his nose. A HEART RATE MONITOR chim rhythmically. Two UNIFORMED OFFICERS look on as Conners and Dekker ente
(to the officers)
Take five, guys. The officers exit. Conners LOCKS the door, walks to the b leans over Richards.
Hiya, Damon. How you feeling?
(taps Conners)
May I? Conners concedes the floor.     Dekker addresses Richards
You remember me, don't you? (Damon gives an EVIL GLARE)
Thought so. Dekker turns his attention to Richards' IV, the tubes whi carry medication into his body.
From a nearby medicine cabinet, Dekker rummages around.

I was skiing about three years ago. Aspen. Beautiful country. Ever been? Never mind. I hit a mogul, landed on a sheet of ice and slammed into a tree. Broke myself up pretty bad. Kinda like you did today. I was in a hospital bed for three months. Had it not been for... Here it is. (he finds) Morphine. Without this stuff, I wouldn't have made it.
Dekker fills a syringe with the entire bottle.
Now this IV drip administers a small dosage every minute. Makes you feel relaxed and calm. No pain. But...
Dekker sticks the syringe needle tip into the IV bag.
If I were to inject this whole thing... That would be all she wrote for Damon.
You don't have the balls.
Dekker PRESSES down on the syringe, just a little, but en to go into the bag. Richards can't believe it.
This equipment malfunctions all the time. Overdoses are quite common. Besides, I don't think the DA's going to launch a full-scale investigation over a scum like you.
Richards attempts to signal for a nurse, but Dekker pulls call button away.
You don't have to tell us a damn thing. Plead the fifth... roll the dice.
Dekker SQUEEZES in some more, until...   Richards gives i signals that he'll talk.
Conners and Dekker exit, head to their car...
You fuckin' hypocrite. You give me shit for my interrogating skills... least I don't threaten them with a lethal overdose.
Dekker holds the empty vile up, hands it to Conners.
There's never been a single case in recorded medical history of someone overdosing on 200 milliliters of saline.
Conners checks the label, smiles.
Bend, not break. That's what you said, right?
Lorenz, AKA SCOTT CURTIS, enters his car.
Lorenz's true identity is Scott Curtis. He's wanted in connection to three other bank robberies, extorsion and kidnapping.
Jenkins stands before Conners, Dekker, Teddy, Vincent and new Detectives - DET. TOMMY BRANCH, 40's and DET. JEROME KNIGHT, 50's.

He's also the brother of John Curtis, the perp Conners shot at Pearl Street Bridge. (Moving on) Richards testifies that he was hired by Curtis to pull the bank job with a dirty cop on the inside, Bernie Callo. Curtis hoped that Conners would take the fall for American National turning ugly, disgracing him even further. We also have the names of two more accomplices, Lamar Galt and Xander Harrington. Everyone was set to meet tonight at ten and we have that address. (beat) After finding Callo and Lei dead today,
JENKINS (cont'd) it doesn't take a rocket scientist to know Curtis is eliminating his accomplices. Doesn't matter what Curtis told Galt and Harrington, he's going to finish them off tonight.
Conners drives, Dekker shotgun.      Conners more intense normal.
You never think of the repercussions. The suspect's mother, father... Brother. How your decision affects them. (beat) He had murder in his eyes.
John Curtis.
It was pouring. Lights everywhere.       If he had only done what I said.
Conners, RAIN POUNDING DOWN, aims his gun, MOUTHS THE WORDS...
Drop the weapon.
JOHN CURTIS, the kidnapper on the bridge, aims his gun,
But it was not to be.
My father died when I was twelve. He walked into a liquor store in the middle of a stick up. Guy just opened fire. Never even had time to react. They said he was a hero. Know what
DEKKER (cont'd) that means to a twelve year old? (beat) Because he died on the job, he's a hero? Never made sense to me.
So why become a cop?

Finish what he started. Every day he went out, trying to do some good. Help the people who couldn't help themselves, just give'em a chance is what he always said. Didn't always work out right, but he tried. You tried to help save that girl on the bridge. If you weren't there, the girl still would've died. She had a chance because you were there. That's all we can do.
A two story house sits on a quiet corner in a quaint neighborhood. CRICKETS CHIRP, break the silence of the night. Two CARS sit in a gravel driveway.
Through the open windows... Two men, LAMAR GALT, 40's, an XANDER HARRINGTON, 30's, sit in silence. Their patience thinning.
IN THE SHADOWS... In various HIDING SPOTS...       Conner Dekker look out at the house.
DET. BRANCH, looks at his watch, then to DET. KNIGHT.
(frustrated; into radio) It's twenty-five after. How much longer we wait?
(into radio) We go now all we get is Galt and Harrington. We want Curtis. Now relax and keep the line free.
CONNERS (cont'd) (to Dekker) This prick's driving me crazy.
Conners digs into his pocket, realizes...
Shit.
What?
I'm out of gum.
(over radio) Head's up. Car's coming.
A BROWN CHEVY drives past the house, but KEEPS GOING.
Shit.
Galt and Harrington react the same to the car driving by. Harrington CHECKS HIS WATCH, barks at Galt. Heads for his car.
Teddy and Vincent watch...
(into her radio) Conners, we got a problem.
(into radio) We hold. No one move.
(into radio) We can't let him walk.   We have to go now.
(into radio) No. Stand down.
(into radio) We're going to lose'em, Conners.
(into radio) No. No go. We wait.
Harrington curses at Galt who stands on the front porch. Harrington waits while Galt he makes a cellphone call.
(into radio) We bust them now, we got something. But if they get in that car we don't have jack squat.
We have three cars here and uniformed backup in all directions, if they ride, we'll get them. I want Curtis. We don't go in that house until I say!
Galt hangs up.     Harrington unlocks his car door.
Harrington's the first to hear it.     In the dead silenc everyone soon does. Just as Teddy's able to silence it... Harrington SPOTS he car, doesn't think twice, just starts FIRING!
His bullets keep Vincent and Teddy pinned down. Knight hurries out of the car... HARRINGTON sees this, FIRES! The bullet STRIKES KNIGHT IN THE NECK!

Simultaneously...    BRANCH FIRES!    HARRINGTON FIRES! THE BULLET RIPS INTO HARRINGTON'S ARM! He's hit, but not down. He and Galt duck back inside the house! Branch takes a bullet in the leg.      He goes down.
Trigger happy, Sons of bitches!
Conners, Dekker, Vincent, Teddy converge on the house.
We take them alive!
(into radio)
All units, all units. Shots fired! Requesting backup immediately! They all rush inside...
Conners and Dekker make their way up the stairs...
Teddy and Vincent head down the hall...
Conners and Dekker move carefully. Conners points for Dek to go in the other direction. Dekker obeys, slides down t other side of the hall.
Teddy's on her toes.   She smells something, but keeps mo
ON THE FLOOR...    A trail of BLOOD leads to the DINING R Teddy signals to Vincent.   "That way."
Conners enters, checks it out.
Dekker stands outside the closet. He opens it quickly, bu it's empty. Except for... On the far wall -- HUNDREDS OF PICTURES of Conners. The same shrine we saw Lorenz in fro of earlier.
Vincent swings in from one entrance, Teddy the other.   S takes a cautious step out, when...
HARRINGTON, from the corner, takes aim again! VINCENT drops to the floor, aims through the dining room table legs and FIRES! THE BULLET TEARS INTO HARRINGTON'S SHIN!   He SCREAMS IN
Conners HEARS THE SHOTS, runs out of the room.
So does Dekker.
Teddy moves in on Harrington.
Drop the gun! Harrington holds his gun UP AND OUT towards Teddy.   Is h aiming or surrendering?
Drop it now. Last warning. But he doesn't.
BAM! TEDDY PUTS A HOLE IN HARRINGTON'S CHEST!       He sl down, dead.
Conners and Dekker meet by the top of the stairs.
Teddy!?     What's happening? Vincent appears at the bottom of the stairs.
We got one down. He's dead.
Dekker and Conners share a look, disappointed.      But t something catches Conners's eye. BEHIND DEKKER...     a door OPENS...   LAMAR GALT AIMS HI

Conners PUSHES DEKKER OUT OF THE WAY, just in the nick of time! DEKKER TUMBLES DOWN THE STAIRS!    Vincent breaks his fal GALT FIRES AT CONNERS, until he's out of bullets.      He back behind a door. Conners FIRES!   But did he hit anyone?     Conners pursu

head_text.subj: 138A AT THE BOTTOM OF THE STAIRS--

text: Dekker grabs his head, in pain, but okay.
Teddy leans against the wall, spots A VENT...       A FLA
Conners creeps inside the partially open doorway. It's quiet, until... LAMAR GALT lunges, tackles Conners! His g flies from his hands.
Teddy's EYES fall to... ON THE FLOOR... next to the base of the door is a FUSE. runs from the wall into the vent. She follows it into THE KITCHEN.
Gas. (loud) Get out of here!     Get out of here NOW!
Vincent and Dekker get up.        Dekker looks upstairs..
Conners!

Conners and Galt struggle. Conners PUNCHES Galt, sends hi back! He then SLAMS Galt against the wall, Galt KNEES Conners in the gut. Galt goes for the gun, Conners KICKS out his legs from underneath him! But before Conners can get the upper hand Galt fights back! The two continue...
The fuse comes out of the vent... IT'S LIT!       THE OVE HEAR the gas emission...
Teddy rushes from the house...
Everyone get down!
The spark.    The Gas.    The EXPLOSION!

head_text.subj: THE BLAST BLOWS DEKKER AND VINCENT THROUGH THE FRONT DOOR

text: The EXPLOSION KNOCKS Conners and GALT OFF THEIR FEET! Conners HITS THE FLOOR HARD! Galt's head slams against th toilet.
Teddy watches as... A COUPLE OF UNIFORMED COPS race to Vincent and Dekker, drag them away.
Conners leans over Galt, a giant GASH across his forehead feels for a pulse. He's dead. Conners looks into the hallway, SEES THE FIRE!
Dekker looks around...
Where's Conners?
Dekker and Teddy look to the house, when...

head_text.subj: DEKKER, VINCENT AND THE TWO OFFICERS DUCK FOR COVER

text: DEKKER gets up, watches the FLAMES CONSUME THE HOUSE! TEDDY runs towards the house, when...   DEKKER stops her.
No!   No, we have to go save him!
We can't.
We have to.
Teddy...
No!
They both stare at the house.    Dekker holds her, she's mess.
Lorenz AKA SCOTT CURTIS watches through a pair of binocul No emotion evident.

FIRE TRUCKS, POLICE CARS and EMERGENCY VEHICLES surround house. The LIGHTS FLASH AN EERIE RED across the scene. FIREMEN try to extinguish the flames. Several NEWS TRUCKS have arrived, always after the story. A CORONER, 40's, zips shut a body bag. Inside the BADLY BURNT BODY of Detective Conners. The BADGE ON HIS BELT st visible. They load him into the truck. TEDDY, her face drained of life, stares at the truck. A Fireman walks behind them, back towards the fire truck. JENKINS huddles with a group of Detectives.
...   If it had to be someone... Teddy and Dekker overhear this.
(To Jenkins)
You sonofabitch.
Teddy...
You've always been jealous of him.
Jealous?
It's because he wasn't only a better cop... He was a better man.
Detective.     Go home. Teddy really wants to explode, but doesn't. She walks awa Jenkins digests what she said, then his eyes find Dekker.
You have something you want to say?
No, Captain. She said it perfectly.
KAREN CROSS finds Teddy, has her Cameraman FOCUS in on he
Detective Galloway, could you give us a comment? Teddy looks STRAIGHT INTO THE CAMERA, but can't say a thi That's when DEKKER grabs the camera, PUSHES it out of her face.
We just wanted a statement.
Shame on you.
This is more than just news for us. American National's CFO sits on the Board of Channel Two. They have a vested interest in what's going on.
Find another source. Karen and her Cameraman leave Teddy and Dekker alone.

Conners was right. We should've never gone in. How many more mistakes can we make in one day? He was eliminating his accomplices. We thought he was going to show up? We didn't even think he could do this... How dumb are we?
Quiet, mostly dark.     A few fluorescent lights and a de lamp... Dekker sits at Conners' desk. A somber moment, reflecting the man, his career. He shuts off the lamp, heads for the door.
Detective? Dekker turns to find...       Dax, cradling a 3,000 PAGE SHOOTING SCRIPT                  MARCH 15, 2004   81. DAX
I know what they were doing inside the bank.
Dax flips through the huge document. DAX
These are today's transaction records from the bank. An average day produces about 400 pages, give or take. Today, there were over 3,000 pages. DEKKER
Meaning? DAX
We've just witnessed the largest heist in history. Somewhere in the neighborhood of a billion dollars. DEKKER
Come again? DAX

It's a computer virus. "The Computer Virus." It randomly withdraws money from all the accounts and deposits it into the bad guys' account. If you check the transactions, no two withdrawal amounts are the same and none of'em are over $100. Most security systems work on the size of the money, not number of transactions. Wire out one million from a handful of accounts and red flags go up. Wire out a less than a hundred from ten million accounts, no flags. DEKKER
Where's the money now? DAX
I tried following one of the transactions. It took me an hour and when I finally had it... It went away. DEKKER
How is that possible? DAX
The virus created a host of phantom accounts where the money goes (MORE)
DAX (cont'd)
temporarily, then transfers to another account, then to another. It's never in one place long enough to get an accurate fix.
It's still moving the money around?
Yeah. Any deposit or withdrawal from any bank doesn't usually go into affect until the next business day. So it's going to keep jumping around until it clears at 9 AM tomorrow.
(realizes)
Or 6 AM Pacific time. Sunrise. So why break in? If they're just wiring money? Couldn't they do that from anywhere?

That's the regional manager's computer terminal. There's no outside/remote access to it. There you have unlimited entry to the bank's mainframe. No passwords to work around, no "hacking" in. It's all nice and clean.
A billion dollars is missing and we're only discovering this now?
Ironically, when the power went out, it helped hide the virus and bought it time to work.
So they weren't trying to make   it look like they were robbing a bank,   to rip off a Saudi Prince? They were    making it look like they ripped off a   Saudi Prince to rob a bank. (realizes)
The Chaos Theory.
Dekker shuffles to his car, his cellphone rings. Answering...
Dekker.
Detective Dekker, there's a call for you. Says it's urgent.
Put it through.
Good evening Detective. I just wanted to compliment you on a fine day. You were an unexpected adversary that was most challenging.
It's not over yet.
Wishful thinking.
No. My wish is to catch you. You're a murderer. A cop killer at that.
I didn't kill anyone who didn't deserve it. Callo was insignificant and Conners crossed me. In years to come you'll thank me for getting rid of him before he corrupted you.
I know about the money. You steal a billion dollars... They will find you.
A risk I'm willing to take. It's almost sunrise. Fare thee well. Lorenz hangs up. Dekker surprisingly calm, hangs up the phone, heads back inside the station.

Dekker at his desk, piles through mounds of paperwork. sure what to look for, he goes through everything. His notes from the bank. The file on Galt, Harrington, Ch Lei. He even digs through Conners and finally... Callo's file. Jenkins heads for the exit.
You're still here?
(in complete work mode)
Callo's insignificant.
What?
That's what he said, Callo's insignificant. But he wasn't.
What are you talking about?
Lorenz...    Curtis...   Called me.
He called you?
He said he didn't kill anyone who didn't deserve it. He said Callo was insignificant. But without Callo he wouldn't have had the knowledge of our department and... (grabs a clipboard)
... He wouldn't have had the front money to hire the crew.

He was screwing with your head. Go home, Shane. You did good today. Your Dad would be proud. Get some sleep. There will be more bad guys tomorrow. Jenkins exits. Dekker falls back into his chair. Then... discovers... Callo's file... The Property Room Sign-Out Sheet. The signatures.
Harry Hume, the evidence room cop, out of uniform, walks inside, sits across from... Dekker, already here, with tw DIFFERENT FILES available to him.
I was in bed already.     This couldn't wait til morning.
DEKKER
(cold) How did he come at you, Harry? It's the only thing that doesn't make sense. HARRY
What are you talking about? DEKKER
All day long we thought Callo was the dirty cop. All day long we were wrong. Dekker slides some papers in front of Harry. DEKKER
That's the sign-out sheet from the evidence room. Here's one of Callo's reports. Here's another one... and another -- The SIGNATURES ARE DIFFERENT, but Harry doesn't even exam them. He knows. DEKKER
They're not the same signature, Harry. They're not even close. HARRY
(shrugs it off) Maybe he had a cramp in his hand.    I don't know. DEKKER
(re: file #1) This is your file... You were reprimanded, a month ago after you confronted Callo at the courthouse. You punched him. That ring a bell? HARRY
And I'd do it again. Cops who testify against cops shouldn't be breathing the same air I do. There's a line you don't cross! DEKKER

So you set him up! You forged Callo's signature, you gave him the money and you helped him with his plan because you thought he got a raw deal at Pearl Street Bridge! Don't deny it, Harry cause I know.

head_text.subj: OF COURSE HE GOT A RAW DEAL AT PEARL

text: Images FLASH before our eyes... The RAIN POURS DOWN!   An SUV CRASHES into a STALLED-OUT VEHICLE. JOHN CURTIS (THE KIDNAPPER) crawls out of the SUV! He see cop's lights approaching. He drags LISA REANN (THE VICTIM out of the truck. A BRIGHT LIGHT (from a helicopter) stri John in the eyes! LIGHTS!   EVERYWHERE BRIGHT!   It's all very BLINDING! COPS block both sides of the bridge!   TV REPORTERS AT EI
John holds the gun up to Lisa's head as... OVER JOHN'S
Lisa struggles, tears streaming down her face.

head_text.subj: A FLASH OF LIGHT ENVELOPS CONNERS

text: John DROPS lifeless to the pavement.
Harry pounds the table...
You're helping a cop killer, Harry. You're a year from pension. This is how you want to go out?
My conscience is clean.
This has been a very long, trying day. And I'm tired. We're chasing a
DEKKER (cont'd)
phantom. Just when we have him... he disappears. He's been two steps ahead of Conners and me all day.
Of course he has.   Who knows Conners better than him?
(what?)
How the hell does Curtis know Conners better than anyone? Harry goes silent.   Realizes he just let the cat out of bag.
(realizes)
We're not talking about Curtis, are we, Harry? (still no response)
Who would know Conners better than anyone? Who would you protect? And who in your mind got the raw deal at Pearl Street Bridge?

head_text.subj: ENTERS CONNERS'S GUN... LISA REANN SCREAMS
CONNERS ON THE BRIDGE HOLDING A GUN.

text: NOW RESUME ACTION... Conners and York aim their guns at.. John holds Lisa tight.
Drop the weapon. Let the girl go. John PUSHES the barrel of the gun TIGHTER into Lisa's tem
That, you don't want to do. York narrows his aim on John Curtis.
One step closer and the girl dies.

Think about this... you kill her, where are you going to... SIMULTANEOUSLY... YORK FIRES just as Lisa STRUGGLES, MOVE The Bullet intended for John Curtis, HITS Lisa, kills her instantly. Lisa's body crumples to the ground. Conners and York look on in horror, knowing York's bullet felled an innocent. John turns to fire on the detectives...      Conners fire KILLS John Curtis! John's body hits pavement.      RAIN POURS DOWN!
Dekker puts it together...
It was York who was the bad cop. He assumed Scott Curtis's identity to throw us off the trail.

location: THE OTHER SIDE OF THE GLASS

text: Dax and Teddy are speechless.
York plays his old partner, knowing all his moves, frames his enemy for the crime, kills him too and pulls off the biggest robbery in history.
Do what you want to me. He called to tell me he was going and he's gone and you ain't never going to find him.
Watch me.
Dax and Dekker gather at Dax's desk.      Dax is on the p
The number York used to call Harry Hume is a cellphone number. Ran it through
DAX (cont'd) local service providers.    Nextel got a match.
Can they get a location on him?
That particular phone he's using is equipped with the latest GPS technology. Should be able to trace his location within 100 meters or less. (into phone) Yeah? (to Dekker) They got him.
Dekker and Dax examine a map.
The signal's coming from around 175th street. That's about fifteen miles north of us. (deflated) From the harbor he can take a boat or a sea-plane out. He's gone.
(beat; thinks) No. If there's a signal. Means he's still here. He's waiting for something or someone.
Waiting? Where? Ain't nothing down there that's open at this hour.
(thinks) 175th street... There's is one place.
Dekker runs to his car and as he gets there, Teddy's wait for him.
I'm going with you.
Detective Galloway...
(w/ a steel glare)
It's not a request.
A BEAUTIFUL, BRIGHT FULL MOON hangs in the dark sky. Doze of COMMERCIAL LINERS, CARGO SHIPS and SEAPLANES line the piers.
Open twenty-four hours a day, 365 days a year. A handful cars occupy the spaces out front. Including the MERCEDES.
A scattering of PATRONS, some at the counter, some in boo A PRETTY WAITRESS, 20's, rings up a bill.
That'll be $8.48, please. YORK AKA LORENZ/CURTIS hands the Cashier a twenty.
Keep the change.
Thanks, mister. A BUS BOY, 19, carries some garbage out the back. York heads for the exits, opens the door and... STEPS
York hoofs two steps outside when... A BRIGHT SPOTLIGHT STRIKES YORK'S FACE!   He shields his eyes... BEHIND THE LIGHTS... Dekker and Teddy aim their pistols.
Jason York... this is the police. Put your hands in the air and slowly get on your knees. Do it. Now!
Don't shoot. You win. York RAISES HIS HANDS HIGH, takes a small step backwards.
Get down on the pavement!
I'm cooperating.   You win.
York takes another tiny back-step.
GET DOWN NOW! FINAL WARNING!
I SAID... I... GIVE... UP!
York bends down to ONE KNEE, DRAWS A 9 MM... FIRES!

head_text.subj: DEKKER AND TEDDY DUCK FOR COVER
YORK RUSHES BACK INTO THE RESTAURANT

text: (to Teddy) Take the back!
Dekker enters, surveys the restaurant.

head_text.subj: A LOUD BANGING FROM THE KITCHEN

text: Dekker approaches the kitchen door, pushes it open and...
Dekker spins out of the way. As gunfire stops, Dekker KIC through the door! Leans in gun first...
In the center of the room... York neck-holds the Pretty Waitress, gun to her head. Dekker moves in...
Was it Harry? It was Harry, right? That fat fuck!
DEKKER
Let the girl go. It's over. York's EYES BLAZE WITH ACTIVITY!    Something brewing. YORK
Easy for you to say. I'm a plane ride away from a King's Ransom. THROUGH A SIDE DOOR... Teddy slides in, unnoticed. DEKKER
Drop the weapon, let the girl go. YORK
And spend the rest of my days in a cage? Let me ponder... (beat) Don't think so. If you're going to stop me... I'm gonna make you earn it. DEKKER
That you don't want to do. YORK
(realizes) That's exactly what I said to him. Do you see the irony here? Am I the only one? Two months ago I was in your shoes. Some punk holding a gun to an innocent girl. What should you do? (beat)

head_text.subj: YOU'D DO EXACTLY WHAT I DID

text: A GLINT sparkles in his eyes.   His teeth grind.    His g

Teddy moves into position from the side!    Then... The BUS BOY enters from the same door Teddy came in. door BANGS closed behind him. York spins, FIRES in that direction! Teddy's HIT!   The Bus Boy retreats out the side door!
Dekker DUCKS away safely. York drags the Pretty Waitress to the back! Dekker runs over, checks on Teddy.
Shit.
I'm fine.    Go get him.
Dekker looks her in the eyes, then darts away.
Dekker exits the back.     Finds the Pretty Waitress.
Which way did he go?
That way.    Down towards the pier.
York sprints across the street.        Dekker follows.

HUNDREDS OF GIANT STEEL CARGO CONTAINERS litter the yard. makes the place look and feel like a GIANT MAZE. York disappears into the steel maze. Dekker enters, slows to a walk. Carefully proceeds forwar Gun drawn. Second guessing each turn.
You've really screwed yourself... Jenkins is going to expect these kind of results from you everyday.
FBI's got a team of 40 computer technicians figuring out Lei's virus. They'll break it.
Dekker rounds a corner...
Your conviction would be admirable, if it wasn't just so sad.
At the far end of the container, York FIRES! Dekker ducks back. York takes a look out, doesn't see Dekker.
Get it through your head... The calvary ain't coming. No heroes are coming to save the day. The bad guy gets away at the end of this story. Dekker peers around the corner... York's gone.
But I'll give you credit... You turned out to be quite the little thorn, didn't you? Dekker speed-walks, continuing the search.
I think Conners would be sorry that you died. But not me. Dekker stops, eyes a full 360. The containers all look alike. Dekker wonders if he's just going around in circle Until...

dive-rolls for cover as... ON TOP OF A CONTAINER... York UNLEASHES, until... CLICK! of ammo. Dekker, hearing this, pops up, RETURNS FIRE! York leaps off the backside of the container! Dekker gives chase. As he circles the container... no Yor Instead, he finds a DOCK.

A narrow wooden dock. There's a few small boats, A TUG BO and at the end... A SEAPLANE. Dekker approaches the tug. Each step slow and deliberate. EYES TRANSFIXED on the seaplane. As he nears the Seaplane... A SHADOW RISES from BEHIND HI From on top of the TUG BOAT! Dekker turns just as... York throws a fishing net on top of Dekker.    As Dekker struggles in the net, HIS GUN DISCHARGES! York with a PIKE POLE in hand, leaps down, CLUBBING Dekke over the head with the weapon. Dekker goes down!

Dekker's gun SLIDES off the dock, into the water. York charges Dekker with the PIKE POLE, ready to stab, when... At the last second... DEKKER ROLLS AWAY! THE PIKE POLE BREAKS A WOODEN PLANK TO PIECES, sticks into the ground beneath the water. Dekker, still tangled in the net, KICKS OUT York's legs. falls to the planks. York quickly rebounds. He POUNCES on Dekker, from behind wraps his arm around Dekker's throat, CHOKING HIM. Dekker struggles to breathe.    York SQUEEZES harder.

I have come this far...      I will not be denied. Dekker fights, arms flailing. He REACHES blindly behind York, grabs a hold of the PIKE POLE. The pole SNAPS in tw Dekker wildly SWINGS at York who dodges easily. York SLAMS Dekker into the side of the TUG.       Still c Dekker, on his last gasp, PUSHES OFF THE TUG! York stumbles backwards, GETS HIS FOOT CAUGHT IN THE HOLE He twists, spinning around, falling down onto... ... THE REMAINING PIKE SPEAR!    The Pike punches through chest... POPS out his back! York, blood and life escaping him, his eyes find Dekker. Then go dead. Dekker steps close.   Holds a cold, remorseless stare at York's body.
Lights Flash from the AMBULANCES AND POLICE CARS. A HELICOPTER HOVERS overhead. Karen Cross interviews Jenkin
Teddy, arm in sling, and Dekker sip on some already cold coffee.
TEDDY

We used to spend all day   Sunday just reading in bed. I would    read the paper and he would read one of   his billion books. I didn't deserve    him. I knew that. But I still loved    him. Teddy stares out the window... POV OF TEDDY - Jenkins speaks to Karen Cross. TEDDY
He's the only man I ever loved. (beat) Did we all get shot today? They can't help but laugh. DEKKER
They said in the city I'd be busy. Every day like this? TEDDY
Pretty much. DEKKER
Great.    I wonder what's next? TEDDY
For me...    a long vacation. Teddy excuses herself to the bathroom.      Dekker goes t the check. AT THE CASHIER...   Dekker reaches for his wallet, opens DEKKER
How much? PRETTY WAITRESS
Do you think I'm going to charge you after all that? Go on. DEKKER

Thanks. Dekker notices the tip jar by the register. He removes a DOLLAR BILL, about to stuff it in the jar... That's when THE SMELL hits him. A strange, but familiar O comes from Dekker's wallet or more accurately... The TEN DOLLAR BILL! But what is it?
Marnie explains to Dekker and Conners...
Do you smell that?
(smells the bills; grimaces)
What is it?
When evidence is taken in, any physical mark might effect the ability to lift prints, so, to mark it, we spray it with a scented solution. Off of Conners' LOOK.
Dekker realizes it's the same smell, but how did this ten in his wallet?
Conners and Dekker get to know one another...      The Wa lays down the check.
Anything else, officers?
Conners drops a TEN DOLLAR BILL on the table.
Dekker SCOOPS UP Conners's TEN, PUTS IT IN HIS WALLET and drops a twenty down on the table.
Dekker, a million thoughts spiral at once, runs from the diner! Teddy exits the ladies room, but Dekker is gone.

PAPERS and BOOKS litter the floor. Dekker trashes the place, looking for a clue of any kind. rifles through the bookshelves, cabinets. All to no avail That's when he finds... a medium-sized paperback, dog-ear and worn. The title of the book... "CHAOS" by James Gleic Dekker flips through the book. Pages are marked, high- lighted. Key words we find include, "EDWARD LORENZ, CHAOS

head_text.subj: THEORY, BIRTH OF A NEW SCIENCE."

text: Dekker holds the "Chaos" book in his hand, paces...
(into phone) You tried them all?/ Nothing for Conners or Lorenz?/ I don't know.        No, maybe he's not on a flight.
Dekker then notices - the book.     The author's name.
Try again.     But try Gleick.   James Gleick.
Early morning TRAVELLERS converge.
Dekker scans the line up of people.      Nothing.
A MAN, 40's, in DISGUISE (Brown Wig), SPIES Dekker. up a CELLPHONE, DIALS... DEKKER'S CELLPHONE RINGS. quickly picks it up.
There's a passage in the Surangama Sutra which, roughly translated means: "Things are not what they appear to be: nor are they otherwise."
Conners? Dekker again scans the line -- he's not there.         He the faces AGAIN, but still nothing.
Think about that a minute... Doesn't that blow your mind? (beat)
What gave me away?
Ten bucks.
At the diner. That's right...       Well, to err is human. Dekker SPOTS A MAN ON A CELLPHONE, he runs up to him, SPI HIM AROUND, BUT... It's not Conners.
Was it Harry that gave him up?
Harry and the phone call. He called me, said Callo was insignificant. Threw up a red flag.
That wasn't him. That was my mistake. I called you.
Conners on his phone, with attached Voice Modulater.
I didn't kill anyone who didn't deserve it.
Dekker at his car... On the phone, listens.       But on ends it sounds like...
Callo was insignificant...

York always thought "the plan" was flawless. He was cocky. I told him you have to leave room for error. You can't always predict how it's all going to play out. A random camera catches an image of Richards, the scent on the money... you. You were the biggest wrench of the day. The Chaos Theory... When you got that... I was impressed.
All day long, we were trying to find out who the inside source was... it was you.
The more information you gather, from as many sources as possible, no matter how unpleasant the methods are, the better. And while I'd like to take sole credit it was a team effort.
(beat) Teddy's pretty devastated about your death.
She'll get over it.

Conners PUSHES DEKKER OUT OF THE WAY, just in the nick of time! DEKKER TUMBLES DOWN THE STAIRS!      Vincent breaks his f Conners FIRES TOWARDS THE DOOR!      After... Conners takes out a small remote detonator.     Pushes th

text: ON THE FLOOR... next to the base of the door is a FUSE. I runs from the wall into the vent. Teddy follows it into T KITCHEN.
Gas.   Get out of here!    Get out of here
The fuse comes out of the vent... IT'S LIT! THE OVEN... HEAR the gas emission... The spark. The Gas.
Conners leans over Galt, a giant GASH across his head, fe for a pulse. He's dead. Conners looks into the hallway,

Conners gets up, and reaches INTO THE BATHTUB, drags out. CORPSE, HOOKS HIS BADGE ONTO THE CORPSE'S BELT and lays h on the floor. Conners QUICKLY opens a LAUNDRY SHOOT, SHIMMIES INSIDE AN SLIDES DOWN...
Conners lands safely on a mattress he left on the floor. Once settled, he pushes the SECOND BUTTON ON THE DETONATO and...
Conners opens a trunk, inside is a FIREMAN'S RAIN COAT,
In the aftermath of the fire...      SEVERAL FIREMAN, POL REPORTERS, etc. are on scene.
Dekker and Teddy don't see... A FIREMAN PASSES BEHIND THE turns his head slightly, REVEAL THROUGH THE VISOR IT'S
Dekker continues his search for Conners all to no avail. TURNS HIS BACK, just as... A MAN WALKS RIGHT PAST DEKKER
So the corpse in the morgue with your name on its toe...?
Scott Curtis won't be bothering anyone again.
You're a serial killer.

Who got killed? Curtis? Harrington, Galt, Lei. They're all hoods. The world's safer with them gone. The kid at the bank... that was unfortunate. But... you live with your decisions. You choose to take this road... there is no half way. It's all or nothing. That's why others fail. They don't make the commitment. I won't make that same mistake.
You said they were all hoods...     what about, Callo?
Callo deserved his fate.      It's his fault.
This is Callo's fault?
If it weren't for him, York and I would've never done this. One random act, causes another, causes another, and in the end... the pattern emerges. That's the Chaos Theory. (beat)
It's after six. The money's cleared. I'm a wealthy man. Lei, for all his
CONNERS (cont'd)
evil, was one smart sonofabitch. The Feds will be tracing false leads for weeks. DEKKER
Lei... you tanked his trial on purpose. CONNERS
They should've suspended me after I testified. What did they expect? DEKKER
And because the "bitch that made her career off you" worked for Channel Two, that's why American National was the target. CONNERS
Everybody who screwed us, got screwed. Everything in its right place. DEKKER
Why not kill me? You had plenty of opportunities. CONNERS
This wasn't about killing, Shane. This was about standing up for what matters. Besides... you kinda grew on me. DEKKER
You're not going to get away. CONNERS (VO)
I already have. I'm not even here now. This is a very valuable lesson for you to learn, and it's good to have learned it early. DEKKER
What's that? CONNERS (VO)
You don't always win. DEKKER
All your years of service for not. You're a hypocrite. CONNERS (VO)
I'm an opportunist. I would've gladly died in the line of duty, but they took that away. If they had been as faithful to me, as I to them none of (MORE)
CONNERS (VO) (cont'd)
this would've happened. The system broke down. Good luck, Detective. It would've been an interesting partnership, but I have to go now. As Dekker continues his search, his cellphone CUTS OFF!
Conners?   Conners? Dekker doesn't notice... THE MAN walks past security and of the Western Airlines terminal.
CONNERS walks through the small area, proceeds out to...
Conners walks down the aisle, finds his seat.
Good morning, Sir. I'll let the Captain know we're ready. She hands him a glass of champagne.
Will there be anything else?
No thank you. I'm fine.
The private plane TAKES OFF!
